intro: Tetractomia kostermansii, commonly known as the Kostermans' tetractomia, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves with a smooth surface. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
